alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 9:27AM CDT until May 30 at 11:54AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 41.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Sunday was 43.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 31.8 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 41.3 feet on 05/21/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 930 AM CDT.
